description: This course explores the use of film as a medium for interpreting the past, using American, Soviet and European films of the 1920s and 30s. Feature films, documentaries and avant-garde films will be viewed and discussed as both expressions and reflections of the interwar years, a period fraught with political, economic and cultural tensions. Some of the topics covered include: mass consumption and leisure, the Great Depression, the rise of fascism, changing social relations between the sexes and the impact of technology on work and everyday life.
name: THE GREAT WAR & SOCIETY
